intro: Dipterygia anethoides, commonly known as the anise-leaved ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its woody stem and dense foliage make it a hardy shrub often found in woodland and wetland habitats. The plant's botanical features contribute to its ecological role as a food source for various insects and birds.
